channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: DOTr chief urges reopening airports in GCQ areas
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Tugade said that commercial airlines can instead utilize regional airports like those in Puerto Princesa, Zamboanga, General Santos and other locations.

item.title: Cardinal Tagle rises as first Filipino Cardinal-Bishop
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Pope Francis has promoted Luis Antonio Cardinal Tagle as Cardinal-Bishop, the highest rank in the Catholic Church's College of Cardinals.

item.title: ‘Balik Probinsya’ program to boost agriculture in provinces
item.description: Sen. Bong Go said the proposed “Balik Probinsya” program may further revitalize the country’s agricultural sector as many city dwellers are reintegrated in the countryside where idle, fertile lands can be developed.

item.title: Arts initiative aims to bring music to COVID patients
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Patients recovering from the coronavirus disease 2019 may soon request musicians to play their favorite songs at bedside.

item.title: UAE sends medical aid to Philippines
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: The United Arab Emirates has sent seven metric tons of medical supplies to the Philippines to support the country’s efforts to curb the spread of the coronavirus diseases 2019.

item.title: Rules set to keep workplace COVID-free
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: With some factories expected to resume soon, the Department of Labor and Employment and Department of Trade and Industry yesterday released guidelines on how to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 in the workplace.

item.title: Duterte’s Labor Day message: Uphold dignity of workers
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Amid a health crisis that has stunted industries and left thousands jobless, President Duterte yesterday reminded businesses in his Labor Day message of their responsibility to improve the lives of workers and safeguard their rights in accordance with the law.

item.title: DOT chief clarifies report on foreign travel restrictions
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Tourism Secretary Bernadette Romulo-Puyat yesterday clarified her statement that international travel this year is unlikely due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Housing department tightens belt amid COVID-19
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: The Department of Human Settlements and Urban Development has started implementing austerity measures in anticipation of the adverse financial and economic impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: 104 discriminatory acts against health workers recorded
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Over a hundred cases of attacks and discrimination against healthcare workers have been recorded by the police since the outbreak of the coronavirus disease 2019 in the country.
